topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Shishir Mehrotra (Coda CEO; ex-YouTube/Google, Microsoft; Spotify board) and previews key episode topics like growth loops, team rituals, Eigenquestions, and reference checks.

topics.title: Sponsor: Coda and Flatfile
topics.summary: Sponsor reads highlighting Coda’s sharing loops and a listener credit offer, plus Flatfile’s CSV import/onboarding pitch and offer.

topics.title: First CEO guest and writing culture
topics.summary: Lenny explains why Shishir is the first CEO guest; they discuss Coda’s internal contest encouraging external writing/publishing and who’s “winning.”

topics.title: Shishir’s most popular docs and bundling
topics.summary: Shishir shares his top-performing Coda docs (Eigenquestions; bundling/“Four Mitzvot Bundling”) and how writing the bundling piece connected to Spotify leadership conversations.

topics.title: Blue Loops and Black Loops framework
topics.summary: Shishir explains Coda’s two growth loops: Black Loop (create→share→create within teams) and Blue Loop (publish to the world), including why maker-only billing removes friction at the share moment.

topics.title: Finding loops and structuring growth thinking
topics.summary: They discuss how founders can discover their own loops (vs funnels), how the Coda diagram emerged, and why candidate conversations can sharpen the narrative and reveal the real growth mechanics.

topics.title: User quality by loop and platform dynamics
topics.summary: Shishir compares activation/retention across entry paths (shared docs highest, published templates next, top-of-funnel hardest) and explains the platform challenge of ceding narrative control to sharers/publishers.

topics.title: Rituals of Great Teams book origin
topics.summary: Shishir describes how a Masters of Scale appearance and Bing Gordon’s “golden rituals” concept sparked a dinner series and then a book, using Coda’s Dory/Pulse as a core example of culture in action.

topics.title: Memorable rituals: Reset and offer-call chorus
topics.summary: Shishir shares standout rituals: Arianna Huffington’s meeting “Reset” (personal one-minute breathing video) and Gusto’s offer calls where all interviewers join to celebrate and sell the candidate on joining.

topics.title: Adopting rituals at Coda: decision roles in Pulse
topics.summary: A concrete example of importing a ritual detail from Coinbase’s RAPIDs: adding explicit decision roles and pre-filled expectations to Pulse to reduce groupthink without drifting into consensus paralysis.

topics.title: Open-source book drafting and community editing
topics.summary: Shishir explains publishing chapters to a ‘brain trust’ for feedback, both to improve quality and to keep the original dinner-series spirit of shared learning.

topics.title: Sponsor Break: Eppo experimentation platform
topics.summary: Sponsor read for Eppo, an A/B testing platform built by Airbnb alumni, emphasizing faster analysis, slicing results, and support for modern experimentation stacks.

topics.title: How rituals form and how to change them
topics.summary: They discuss how rituals emerge organically vs being designed, when rituals should evolve with company stage or ‘wartime,’ and Shishir recommends the Heath brothers’ Switch framework: direct the rider, motivate the elephant, shape the path (name it, teach it, template it).
